page.title: 05INDUSTRIAL LANDSCAPE-WIDNES
page.content: { Rubble}piled up like giant molehills. Cooling towers tall and menacing spilling out smoke. Rotting wood soft and crumbling food for the lice. Old car tyres lying in the mud like slimy black slugs. { Wild flowers}struggling through the sludge delicate but strong to survive. Rusty metal strips coiled like iron worms on the ground. Metal pipes and tubes dinted and narrow _ a playground for the rats. { Rats hole,}dark and deep, humans like us will never know whats inside. { River Mersey}smelly and polluted, chemicals lie beneath the waves. { Derelict railway lines,}overgrown with grass.Green moss like sores on the old railway walls. { Rusty steam engine}left to die. "Guard dogs on patrol". Nothing left to guard.{(ST.MICHAELS.)
